info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 5 at 11:35AM EDT until April 5 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Mahoning and Stark.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1134 AM EDT, members of the public, trained spotters, and the department of transportation reported flooding in the advisory area and urban and small stream flooding will continue through the afternoon. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Youngstown, Boardman, Alliance, Louisville, Campbell, Canfield, Sebring, Minerva, Hartville, Waynesburg, Austintown, Struthers, Poland, Ellsworth, New Middletown, East Canton, Craig Beach, Lowellville, Beloit and Limaville.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
